<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:

The apiserver, controller-manager and scheduler are configured to use IPv4 addresses
```
e2e-427a309747-674b9-master/kube-apiserver.log:Flag --address has been deprecated, see --bind-address instead.
e2e-427a309747-674b9-master/kube-apiserver.log:I1217 22:45:00.821238       1 flags.go:33] FLAG: --bind-address="0.0.0.0"
e2e-427a309747-674b9-master/kube-apiserver.log:I1217 22:45:00.821439       1 flags.go:33] FLAG: --insecure-bind-address="127.0.0.1"
e2e-427a309747-674b9-master/kube-controller-manager.log:I1217 22:45:01.209980       1 flags.go:33] FLAG: --bind-address="0.0.0.0"
e2e-427a309747-674b9-master/kube-scheduler.log:I1217 22:45:01.708072       1 flags.go:33] FLAG: --bind-address="0.0.0.0"
```

however, are serving on all addresses IPv4 and IPv6

```
grep -r "Serving securely on"
e2e-427a309747-674b9-master/kube-apiserver.log:I1217 22:45:23.964711       1 secure_serving.go:178] Serving securely on [::]:443
e2e-427a309747-674b9-master/kube-controller-manager.log:I1217 22:45:05.013169       1 secure_serving.go:178] Serving securely on [::]:10257
e2e-427a309747-674b9-master/kube-scheduler.log:I1217 22:45:16.477534       1 secure_serving.go:178] Serving securely on [::]:10259
```

**What you expected to happen**:

To listen only on the IP family specified

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

https://gist.github.com/aojea/92b53f2989b83644abc3eb75314330af

or checking in one of the gce presubmits jobs

https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/86015/pull-kubernetes-e2e-gce/1206634555675512835/artifacts/e2e-5d306d63b1-674b9-master/kube-apiserver.log

**Anything else we need to know?**:

it seems that the apiserver, controller-manager and kube-scheduler listen on all IP families by default despite the IP family address configured

```
cmd/kube-controller-manager/app/options/options.go:                     BindNetwork: "tcp",
cmd/kube-scheduler/app/options/options.go:                              BindNetwork: "tcp",
cmd/kube-scheduler/app/options/options.go:                              BindNetwork: "tcp",
cmd/cloud-controller-manager/app/options/options.go:                    BindNetwork: "tcp",
```
